  • Constructor Details

    • NAR_CANSparkMax

      public NAR_CANSparkMax(int deviceNumber, com.revrobotics.CANSparkLowLevel.MotorType type, NAR_CANSparkMax.EncoderType encoderType, double kP, double kI, double kD)
      Create a new object to control a SPARK MAX motor
      Parameters:
      deviceNumber - The device ID.
      encoderType - The type of encoder used, ie. relative build in encoder or absolute encoder connected by an adapter.
      type - The motor type connected to the controller. Brushless motor wires must be connected to their matching colors and the hall sensor must be plugged in. Brushed motors must be connected to the Red and Black terminals only.
      kP - The proportional coefficient of the on board PIDController.
      kI - The integral coefficient of the on board PIDController.
      kD - The derivative coefficient of the on board PIDController.

    • NAR_CANSparkMax

      public NAR_CANSparkMax(int deviceNumber, com.revrobotics.CANSparkLowLevel.MotorType type, NAR_CANSparkMax.EncoderType encoderType)
      Create a new object to control a SPARK MAX motor
      Parameters:
      deviceNumber - The device ID.
      type - The motor type connected to the controller. Brushless motor wires must be connected to their matching colors and the hall sensor must be plugged in. Brushed motors must be connected to the Red and Black terminals only.
      encoderType - The type of encoder used, ie. relative build in encoder or absolute encoder connected by an adapter.

  • Method Details

    • initShuffleboard

      public void initShuffleboard(String tabName, String prefix, int column)
      Adds a PID tuning setup to a specific shuffleboard tab. Editing a value on the tab will automatically update the value on the controller.
      Parameters:
      tabName - The title of the tab to select.
      prefix - String added before each name of PID widgets.
      column - Column to add the PID widgets to.

    • setCurrentLimit

      public void setCurrentLimit(int limit)
      Sets the current limit in Amps.

      The motor controller will reduce the controller voltage output to avoid surpassing this limit. This limit is enabled by default and used for brushless only. This limit is highly recommended when using the NEO brushless motor.

      The NEO Brushless Motor has a low internal resistance, which can mean large current spikes that could be enough to cause damage to the motor and controller. This current limit provides a smarter strategy to deal with high current draws and keep the motor and controller operating in a safe region.

      Specified by:
      setCurrentLimit in class NAR_Motor
      Parameters:
      limit - The current limit in Amps.

    • setPeriodicFramePeriod

      public com.revrobotics.REVLibError setPeriodicFramePeriod(com.revrobotics.CANSparkLowLevel.PeriodicFrame frame, int periodMs)
      Set the rate of transmission for periodic frames from the SPARK MAX

      Each motor controller sends back status frames with different data at set rates. Use this function to change the default rates.

      Status 0: Applied Output, Faults, Sticky Faults, isFollower

      Status 1: Motor Velocity, Motor Temperature, Motor Voltage, Motor Current

      Status 2: Motor Position

      Status 3: Analog Sensor Voltage, Analog Sensor Velocity, Analog Sensor Position

      Status 4: Alternate Encoder Velocity

      Status 5: Duty Cycle Absolute Encoder Position, Duty Cycle Absolute Encoder Absolute Angle

      Status 6: Duty Cycle Absolute Encoder Velocity, Duty Cycle Absolute Encoder Frequency

      Parameters:
      frame - Which type of CANSparkLowLevel.PeriodicFrame to change the period of
      periodMs - Period in ms for the given frame.
      Returns:
      REVLibError.kOk if successful

    • setStatusFrames

      public void setStatusFrames(NAR_CANSparkMax.SparkMaxConfig config)
      Set the rate of transmission for periodic frames from the SPARK MAX

      Each motor controller sends back status frames with different data at set rates. Use this function to set to team 3128's preset rates.

    • enableContinuousInput

      public void enableContinuousInput(double minInput, double maxInput)
      Enables continuous input.

      Rather then using the max and min input range as constraints, the motor considers them to be the same point and automatically calculates the shortest route to the setpoint.

      Overrides:
      enableContinuousInput in class NAR_Motor
      Parameters:
      minInput - The minimum value expected from the input.
      maxInput - The maximum value expected from the input.
